examples: The recursive nature of stories which borrow from each other

definitions.definition: of an expression , each term of which is determined by applying a formula to preceding terms
of a program or function that calls itself
which can be computed by a theoretical model of a computer, in a finite amount of time

computing theory , not comparable , of a set
